"...and so I've decided to go back to Earth for a time," said Amanda. "Amia, you will look after things here, and Sofia, you will look after the rest of the universe for me?" The two angels nodded. "Good. Now, before I go, I need to speak with Sofia privately."

After Amia and Cressida left, Sofia said, "The rest of the universe? How am I supposed to look after the rest of the universe when the bodies I have are barely sufficient to monitor the planets you've agreed to protect?"

"I've decided to give you a gift. I know how much you like being in so many bodies, so I'm going to change how often you split. The endless chambers are aptly named, and you'll need them now that you'll be splitting every trillionth-day."

"Every what?" spluttered Sofia.

"Every trillionth-day," repeated Amanda calmly. "This will ensure that you will always have the bodies to carry out any tasks I set for you, as well as having enough for anything you might want to do yourself. Now," said the Goddess, changing the subject, "I presume you've met with various authorities on all the planets I protect. What are your first impressions?"

"Mostly positive," said the princess. "There are a few places where the rulers were hostile, but Vestivia was certainly the worst. Their king has your worshippers executed! How could your predecessors ever have agreed to protect such a planet?"

Amanda sighed. "Vestivia is a disappointment. My immediate predecessor--I do not consider Barry to be one in my line, and Jack was God for too short a time, in this timeline, at least, to matter--agreed to protect them early in his reign, but shortly thereafter their society collapsed.

"Vestivian society used to be almost completely egalitarian. Their rulers were a group of ten women, each with some innate powers--telepathy, always, and usually some other abilities. They almost never met, but communicated mentally over long distances. They monitored their populace--and occasionally implanted suggestions for some of them to visit, where the lucky chosen were shown pleasures beyond any they had known, and thus the rulers were often thought of as sex goddesses--and, since they could amplify each other's unique abilities, protected their planet from outside threats, as there had always been one of them who was telekinetic.

"But eventually there was none among the ten who possessed that power, and when a large meteor threatened the planet, they could not divert it. But their efforts attracted my predecessor's attention, and he agreed to protect Vestivia, mostly by ensuring that certain other powers would always manifest themselves among the ten, receiving in exchange the deciding vote whenever the ten were deadlocked on a matter of planetary governance.

"This arrangement lasted a few millennia, until a boy was born who was essentially a blank to the rulers. They could not sense him or affect him. He grew up, slew them and took over as ruler. He figured out how to test newborn girls for the powers and had them ruthlessly lobotomized to ensure none would challenge his rule.

"Eventually an angel was sent to visit three descendants of the last ten rulers. They attempted to spark a revolution that would restore the old system, but the king was brutal in suppressing the rebellion. After that my predecessor simply put up a sort of shield around Vestivia to ward off threats and wrote them off as a lost cause.

"I sent you there so that you would see what their society was like, and I am telling you this so that you will understand why I am doing what I will do." Amanda slouched slightly.

"What will you do?"

"My powers are infinite, Sofia, but my predecessors rarely used their powers to any great extent, preferring to use them for recreation and shying away from affecting matters on a large scale, preferring to let the unaltered universe take its course. But I have decided to correct Vestivia. I will restore its old ways."

"Just like that?" said Sofia.

"Just like that," said Amanda. "I have looked into many probable futures, and in none of them, no matter what you do, does Vestivia improve. But if I make this change..."

Amanda sagged as if she had put in a great effort. "It is done.

"You will be the eleventh of the rulers of Vestivia, Sofia. I think you may enjoy it. Supernatural abilities are expected of the rulers, so you can be freer in displaying your abilities than you can be elsewhere. Even the ability to manifest in multiple places is not unheard of, so you can bring in more bodies as you want. I would recommend not showing all that you can do, of course."

"But if their entire world just changed, won't the rulers be new to the task?"

"No. Changing their world was easy, but to do it I had to communicate with my predecessor across time and persuade him of the necessity. The only change needed was to alter that one boy so that he, as with all other Vestivians, could be monitored by the rulers. His urges were sensed and safely turned to other ends. The barbaric period in their history is now remembered only by those of us who are removed from time, as we are. Your role will be to serve as my proxy among their rulers and to alert them to the existence of other such children--the mutation can certainly happen again, and while it allows its bearers to hide from the rulers, your powers are far greater."

"And when I'm not keeping the rulers safe from their own people or deciding the course of planetary law, then what?"

"Well, keeping Vestivia safe from natural disasters is still your task, but those happen infrequently. So while you're not doing that, have fun as a sex goddess."

Amanda vanished and Sofia found herself in chambers richer and more elegant than even her mother's rooms on Janosia. She could sense ten presences hovering at the corner of her mind.

"Welcome," one said.

"We welcome the emissary of God," said another.

"We hope she will soon grace us with her presence," said a third.

"We hope you will find our planet pleasing and worthy."

As the mental greetings continued, Sofia laid down on a pile of cushions and brought in another three bodies.

"I thank you for your greeting," she said in response. "I am here to safeguard you from threats, internal and external, and I hope that my presence among you will not diminish you in any way."

Another voice spoke. "No, it does not diminish us. You are one of us now."

Yet another voice spoke, accompanied by images in Sofia's mind--images of Vestivians, she knew. "We have certain entertainments here, as you know, and if I might suggest a few ways to begin..."
